page.title: 13RELIGION IN LINGFIELD
page.content: The imposing parish church of St. Peter and St. Paul is in Lingfield Old Town. Although not mentioned in the Domesday Book, it is thought to date from the 11th century. Its unusually large size, together with its fine brasses and tomb sculpture, point to a prosperous history. Although physically secluded, the church plays a lively part in the Christian community's activities, under the guidance of the vicar, Mr Ramsay. A short distance away is the 30-year old Catholic church of St. Bernard, whose priest is Father Charlton. The only other church is the Mormon Temple at Newchaple. Members of other denominations must travel to Dormansland or East Grinstead to worship.
